conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls have vertical height and thickness, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose interiors.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with consistent wall thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway and stable angled view with only minor simplification at some corners/joins.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (living/kitchen top, two bedrooms bottom corners, baths/closet in expected zones). Minor proportional/partition differences visible in corridor/bath/door placements relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (sofas, dining table, beds) plus kitchen and bathroom fixtures. Some items are simplified and not perfectly matching the 2D furniture layout/placement.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with good separation of walls/floors and adequate lighting. Text labels embedded in the 3D view reduce presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Some door/opening locations and/or swing/orientation appear simplified or slightly shifted compared to the 2D plan.
Furniture layout does not perfectly mirror the 2D plan; some placements/scales are approximated.
Text labels present in the 3D render (e.g., room name), reducing presentation/background cleanliness.

summary: A clear, true 3D cutaway conversion with strong layout fidelity, with only minor deviations in openings and furniture plus small presentation contamination from text labels.
